message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of searching persons in large-scale image databases with natural language queries, which is a common task in video surveillance. This task involves visual-textual association, which is a core issue in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL). The paper proposes a novel approach that involves attention mechanisms, which are commonly used in both computer vision and natural language processing. The paper also addresses the problem of negative pair mining, which is a common issue in machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on a person search dataset (cs.CV) and a caption dataset (cs.MM).
